Reviews.Title: “Nice new experience”
Reviews.Author: Abu G
Reviews.Content: I have visited Turkey many times, but never the Asian side of Istanbul. Happily, my first stay there was at the Byotell, which was pleasant and efficient. A minor drawback was distance from the airport, necessitating to a long and expensive cab: maybe the hotel could run a shuttle for the convenience or ordinary travelers like me.

Reviews.Title: “too short stay to evaluate it in a proper way”
Reviews.Author: expat72
Reviews.Content: It was really short stay... 2 a.m. till 10.00 a.m. (8 hours including the meal). Nice service, good breakfast, great sleeping quality.

Reviews.Title: “poor quality”
Reviews.Author: Emreeu
Reviews.Content: In which 5 star or even 2 star hotel would the water be cut in the morning, your toilet is not cleaned, you write a complaint letter to the hotel manager, and no one would be so kind to make any little explanation??? Very poor service, with very weird staff... May be suitable for just sleeping for one night but definitely not an option for longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “Its OK”
Reviews.Author: Tripper21
Reviews.Content: Good size room, decent SPA and Free WIFI that works... Room was spacious and clean and well serviced. Very modern bathroom Only downside was my room had a problem with the plumbing that lead to an awful smell in the bathroom each morning and each evening. Needed to keep window open for ventilation.

Reviews.Title: “Different world, but nice”
Reviews.Author: ITexperts
Reviews.Content: Positive: Definitely this hotel is one of the best where I have been as far as room cleanliness and view from the window. large, spacious rooms. The SPA center also worth to check, good value indeed. Negative: Breakfast ... well, yes I prefer European breakfast and since Muslims does not eat pork then It's impossible to have any. Alcohol - if you prefer cold beer and MTV, then better stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious”
Reviews.Author: sm_it_101
Reviews.Content: My stay at Byotell turkey has been a fulfilling one, the hotel has got large spacious rooms and has a good service. I booked a 2 bed room but when I arrived at the hotel i was offered a 3 bed family room which was a plus point during my stay. Hotel has got a fantastic breakfast with a wide varity of options to choose from. A good restaurant where the chef used to prepare customized meals on request (which is rare for a 4start hotel). Overall a worthwhile stay.

Reviews.Title: “high quality for business”
Reviews.Author: kranewitter
Reviews.Content: This hotel presents high quality for business travelers. The rooms are very big, the bathroom and toilet clean and the service is outstanding. Breakfast buffet is really rich and even if there is no pork meat and alcohol served in the whole hotel - which I see as a concession to the islamic religion to accept this - you will not starve a minute. If you have a problem, you can always ask one of the employees, who are always speaking an understanable English. I stayed there more than 10 times, and I will continue doing so.

Reviews.Title: “not really good”
Reviews.Author: recentguest2011
Reviews.Content: far from real 5 star service though the staff is doing their best

Reviews.Title: “All business - Zero Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: spencekersey
Reviews.Content: Like another who reviewed this hotel whilst actually here, i am currently sitting in the hotel after two days our of a 4 day stay. I am here on business first and foremost so location wise for my clients and staff this is perfectly located, not sure in the grand scheme of visiting Istanbul how well located it would be but for my purpose location is ok. The rooms are clean enough, if a little dated in design and presentation, as a seasoned business traveller i would say it is in line with the 110 euros per night i am paying to stay here but not worth any more than that. Pros as i see them 1) well located 2) clean and tidy 3) located right next to a huge shopping mall which is very modern and has lots of shops - a handy bridge leads to within 200 yards of it Cons as i see them (which unfortunately outweigh the pros) 1) No alcohol served here - at first i thought this wasnt going to be a problem as i thought a few days detox that will be great, but funny thing is when you know you cant get it, you want it even more! i find myself gagging for a cold beer at the end of the day but knowing i cant get one! 2) the internet is so tightly restricted i cant even look at any website remotely outside of their strict firewall. and as a solo traveller with not much to do, not even leenks works (which isnt porn by the way- even though every site i have tried so far has not worked! may aswell be honest! haha) 3) the front of house staff say the right things but dont act on them, 4 times i asked for simple information with the promise of a call back only to find myself chasing them up 4) the breakfast buffet is one of the strangest mixes of foods ive witnessed! am i being culturally insensitive when i say "who on earth eats a full green salad for breakfast" i bet there will be a deluge of morning salad eaters contacting me now. 5) if you are English (or use English as your main spoken language - the same for any language outside Turkish, then forget watching TV, one channel (BBC f'ing news!!) and fashion TV who lets be honest, nobody watches!! 55 channels, all turkish with the exception of RTL, TV1 and BBC News. So to sum up in the words of my Dad who just phoned me, enjoy the news and your glass of milk!! All the best.

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative on the Asian side of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ANISSAB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel while visiting family. We traveled with our children (6,5 yrs & 15 months). We booked a triple room. The room was nice and spacious with a separate room for the 3rd bed. Carpeting looked a little old and not so clean. The towels also needs to be changed. The hotel doesn't serve alcohol as it is a Spa hotel... Breakfast is great, wide variety of local & international food. Service was professional and nice with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel with centrally located”
Reviews.Author: bhavinmehta17
Reviews.Content: The rooms were quite clean though bit small. It was quite comfortable with small mini bar and microwave. The bathroom was clean with nice bath fittings. The breakfast was ok nothing great. The breakfast selection, provided was a variety of salads, cheeses, fruit, breads, pastries, hot stuff in tureens, juices and ... quails eggs of all things. Not a standard continental / western european/american choices, but ok. The staff are quite there to help you in all the way they are polite and helpful. Location wise i believe it is not good for visitors are it is located in commercial area on the asian side of the Bospherous. Though it was a stone throw from my office. Considering the Turkey traffice to be very much this is quite a drive from the airport. Gym is maintained well. It is large and pretty well equipped and staffed. Conference facilities downstairs are good too. Overall a good business choice, but for not so good for pleasure

Reviews.Title: “A good business option”
Reviews.Author: shaun1967
Reviews.Content: I sit in the Byotell as I write this, using the cable internet connection that works quite well. I'm not paying for it, but I think someone else is, don't think its free. My room is a small corner room. Clean, comfortable with nice bathroom fittings. The mini-bar, as others have pointed out is stocked with soft drinks and water, plus there is a little tray with crisps and nuts in it. Took breakfast this morning and found it a bit odd, in a good way, I think. First, I was comfortably out-numbered by staff desperate, it would seem, for something to do. That meant I got that weird over-attentive type service where every spent tea-spoon is whipped away the second it hits the table. The breakfast selection, on the other hand, bordered on bewildering. Very large choice of salads, cheeses, fruit, breads, pastries, hot stuff in tureens, juices and ... quails eggs of all things. Not standard western european/american choices, but very good. Location wise it isn't great. It is in a busy commercial area on the asian side of the Bospherous, quite a drive from the airport if the traffic is heavy. Service at reception is pretty good. Polite but not over the top. Gym (which I just used) is large and pretty well equipped and staffed. Conference facilities downstairs are good too. Overall a good business choice, but for any other reason? Not sure

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on the Asian side (but not for drinkers)”
Reviews.Author: PickyBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have checked into this hotel after staying a week at another "5-star" hotel in the area (see my other review for details). Hence, my impressions of Byotell are colored by the previous experiences at the other hotel. First of all, the air conditioning works very well. Also, the hotel is in a modern glass and concrete (or marble) building, close to a major highway, but in a nice area, that has a safe feel to it. There is a pedestrian bridge across the highway, within a few hundred feet from the hotel, which takes you to a major shopping mall, whichhas many restaurants within a short walk - none of the underbelly feel of the other hotel. I liked the fact that my room also had a window that opens out, despite the office-tower look of the building. I must say that Byotell presents a different take on the luxury hotel - it is very contemporary, with the room decor that combines warmth and modernity, with a hint of middle-eastern opulence.. My room was much smaller than at the other hotel, but it was quite adequate foro one person, and would do for a coupe, too. According to the floor plan which i checked for location of fire escape (a good idea for anyone), this is the smallest room on the floor (xx01), i.e. another room will be bigger. The furniture arrangement is well thought out and the closet by the entrance provides enough storage. There were 3 armchairs in the room, which, while not super plush, were nonetheless comfortable to spend long hours working in. The hotel provides wired (not wireless) Internet, which apparently costs extra (though it was included in the negotiated rate that my customer enjoys with them). The bathroom is nice and spacious, with modern, high-end fixtures. The towels are thick and substantial (though they could have been a bit softer). The bathroom greets the visitor with the various toiletries - there are tubes of shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, body lotion, and bath crystals, all different color, for a very nice visual impression. The bed is comfortable, but a bit hard for my liking (though I am spoiled with my tempur-pedic bed at home). My room had only a 19 (or so) inch TV. However, it had around 30 channels working, and unlike the other place, which only had a BBC News channel of English-language programs, this one had BBC, CNN, and Bloomberg news, as well as the CNBC (I think), broadcasting US entertainment programs in English, albeit with Turkish subtitles. There is a number of German(3), French(2), Italian, Greek, Spanish channels, a Russian channel, and 2-3 programs in Arabic. Indeed, the hotel caters to the Islamic sensibilities - it does not serve alcohol, neither in the restaurants, nor in the mini-bar, so if you are a drinker, you will not be able to indulge - the restaurants do not serve vine with the meals, and the top floor, which clearly was set up as a bar, stays empty. Even the mini-bar in the room contains sodas and juices, but no beer or liquor. I am not sure how they would react if a guest brought his own alcohol and they saw it, but I am sure with a bit of discretion, one could easily work around their setup. Still, it is a small price to pay for the otherwise nice accommodations that the hotel provides. Hotel information says that they do it out of concern for the patrons' health - there is a health club and spa in the hotel - but at the same time, they do allow smoking, so they can't be too concerned aobut visitors' well-being. There are 2 restaurants open for lunch and dinner, which seem to be really a one restaurant - they share the menus and staff. They have a slightly different decor, and one is non-smoking. In my experience, it stayed empty most of the time (although I am a non-smoker, I did not want to be completely by myself in a dining room). The food is good, with many local choices. The breakfast buffet is very nice, with wide selection of cheezes, cereals, baked items, and local hot dishes. There is no made-to-order omlette/egg station, and it is perhaps a notch below the other place, but overall, there is more selection than one can try in a few days. Like in the other hotel, there is no alarm clock in the room, so you would do well to bring your own. The outlets are all local (two rounded prongs), but the front desk was kind enough to give me an adapter. They also give out Internet cables to the guests. The staff is very friendly, and the customer service is a notch above the rest. I have ordered a wake-up call, and on two occasions I did not hear the phone ring. They had actually sent somebody up to my room to knock on the door to make sure I was awake. I have never seen this before. The second time it happened was on the morning I was to check out, which allowed me to make it to the airport on time, even if with some regret about leaving this neat place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: thehappyvoyager
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home from a long-weekend stay at the Byotell in Ä°stanbul, and my overall experience is good! I travelled there with my partner, so we booked a double room, which we paid â‚¬120 per night for, which I thought was good value for money. The room we got was on the 10th floor, with fabolous views over the city, and it was neat and clean, spot on I'd say! The location, well it isn't central, but the public transport is good, and KadikÃ¶y is just a short busride away, from where you could take a ferry to the European side, and local businesses in the area give good value for money. The service in the hotel is what you would expect from a five star hotel, the staff's knowledge of English is so-so, as my partner speaks Turkish, we did not have any problems at all. The only negative, if any is that the hotel does not serve alcohol, but that is clearly stated on their website, so it does not come as a "bad" surprise. The breakfast-buffe offer a good selection, with plenty to choose from and it is fresh and tasty. So I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for business”
Reviews.Author: ChristianK
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights for business at the Byotell and was very surprised about the price value. I paid 90â‚¬ incl breakfast for a junior suite with two bed rooms, all very clean and well maintened. Breakfast was above average and included in the business rate. The hotel is located 40min driving distance from the AtatÃ¼rk airport (42â‚¬ Taxi) on the Asian side next to a main highway (no noise) with some nice local shops close to the hotel. It is in a better residental area of Istambul with easy access. Hotel does not serve alcoholic beverages which is no problem for me but could be for other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel with good facilities and service”
Reviews.Author: Travelguy0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the office of our agent and he booked the room. The hotel is new from 2007 and on the Asian site of Istanbul. During rush-hour it can take up to two hours to get to the airport or European site of Istanbul. The reception was friendly and knowledgeble. The knowledge of English is sufficient to get everything arranged. The room was new and clean with a good bed and badroom. There is a flatscreen TV and a cable connection to the internet which works perfect. Wifi internet is available in the lobby only. Shower and bath facilities are very good, water pressure and temperature can be adjusted. I had a room on the 13th floor with a nice view. The only problem is the limited capacity of the three elevators, so it takes a while to get up and down. The breakfast restaurant is on the first floor and has a good selection. This hotel serves no alcohol or pork meat (a pity as I enjoy some bacon for breakfast ever now and then). All in all a great place to stay if you need to be in this particular area of Istanbul. Don't stay here if you want to visit the tourist attractions!

HotelInfo.Name: Byotell
HotelInfo.Address: Saniye Ermutlu Sok No 3 | KozyataÄŸÄ±, Istanbul 34742, Turkey
